moves.1... e5: i answer with my normal opening
moves.2. Qf3: i don't know quite what he is thinking, maybe attack f7?
moves.2... Nf6: i open by attacking the enemy pawn
moves.3. Bc4: he continues the three move checkmate, even though my knight has put a stop to it
moves.3... Bc5: i continue my normal opening and getting ready to castle at the same time
moves.4. d3: it looks like he is going to bring his bishop out
moves.4... d6: maybe i should of castled there, but i do that instead
moves.5. Bg5: i thought he might of done that when i saw he moved his d2-d3 pawn
moves.5... Nc6: i still have the opportunity to castle
moves.6... Qxf6: a move which can be discussed was that a good move or bad... in my opinion it was good
moves.7... gxf6: and i can forget castling king side
moves.8. c3: he starts getting a good pawn formation
moves.8... Bg4: i stop him castling queen side, for now
moves.10. Bxe6: he liked to swap things i found out in my first game
moves.10... fxe6: i got a good control over the center i feel
moves.11... d5: i plan to take his pawn and by doing that i can break up his formation and get rid of the double pawn formation on e line
moves.12... exd5: and now i feel i have got a good control of the area
moves.13. Na3: a knight at the side is grim... learnt that of jkarp a very good player who has commented on all my annotated games and taught me quite a bit (even though later on my knight goes on the edge a couple of times)
moves.13... O-O-O: i castle as planned, looking back at move 4 one would think i would castle king side
moves.15. d4: a blunder in my opinion, as i got three pieces protecting it, whilst he has two
moves.16... Bxd4: i chose bishop, but one could argue that i should of taken it with knight
moves.17... Nxd4: i take and i am a pawn up, an advantage i don't give away
moves.18... Ne2+: and i start a knight attack
moves.19. Kf2: not wanting to lock his king in a corner
moves.19... Nc3: i retreat with my knight, but keep control of a good area
moves.20... d4: and i try for a queen
moves.21. Rac1: that move didn't mean much for me
moves.21... Rd6: i got ready to double up my rooks/castles. What is the right name for them?
moves.22... Nxa2: when i see an unguarded pawn i usually take it
moves.23... Nxb4: and another pawn up for me
moves.24... d3: i push up for a queen
moves.25. f4: he has a nice line of pawns
moves.26. Rd1: and no surprise there he stops me
moves.27. Rc3: and he has not seen it
moves.27... Nb2: opps, i have forced him to move his castle
moves.29. Nxa7+: and he comes and checks me
moves.30. Nc6+: why????? he gave me his knight
moves.31. Rb3+: he tries to take my knight
moves.32... cxb5: and i take it... i am a knight and two pawns up, which at this point of the game is very important
moves.33. Rxd2: i had almost forgotten that pawn
moves.34. Rc2: i don't really have to answer here
moves.35. Rb2: he is trying to pick of my pieces
moves.35... c6: not that i will let him
moves.36. Rb3: i had expected a move like that
moves.37. Kh3: a move i wouldn't have done, as he can no longer move left
moves.38... Kc7: i had two choices Kb7 or Kc7, i could also move castle, but that would mean losing (most likely) the left flank
moves.41... Nf2+: i try and find a way to weaken his position
moves.43... Kd6: i stop him from checking me again
moves.44. Rg7: it looks like he is about to start an attack
moves.44... b4: i just move my pawns quite like and wait for the big and final attack of white to start
moves.47. Kg4: he will soon get a castle if i am not careful
moves.47... b3: well i would rather have a queen
moves.48... b2: he can not stop me from getting a queen
moves.50. Rg5+: an unexpected move, i expected Kg5
moves.51. Rg7: and i start a a checking spree :D
moves.51... Qe4+: the only good check i could do, i studied Qh7 and swap castle for queen, but thought i would do this instead
moves.52... Qh4+: two possibilities, Qxf6 or check here, i chose check for now
moves.53... Qf2+: i am really just chasing him around
moves.54. Ke4: and now i realize that i should of taken the pawn
moves.55. Ra7: i don't think he wants to lose the castle
moves.55... c5: i begin pushing up for another queen
moves.56. Ra6+: you could call my last  move a blunder, but look at it like this, 1 king vs. 1 castle, 1 knight, 1 pawn and 1 king, that is how i looked at it like
moves.56... Ke7: any other move and i would not of won
moves.59... Ne3+: i wanted to check that my knight was still alive, after not using him so long... i had thought of sacrificing that piece, but i did not need to
moves.62. Kc3: he goes back to attacking me
moves.62... Rh4: and to make sure i did not get a forced draw, i moved my castle
moves.63... Ke5: i move up to protect my pawn
moves.64. Kc3: stopping me from going to d4
moves.64... Kd5: it will take a move longer for my queen
moves.66. Kc1: the next moves are quite boring
moves.66... c3: as i try to get a queen and he tries to stop me
moves.67... Rh2+: have to be careful of stalemate
moves.68. Kc1: as he is locked dawn in 1 row
moves.69. Kd1: he does one of two moves possible
moves.69... c2+: and of course he will not move to e1 which will give me checkmate in 1
moves.73. Ka2: the end is close... closer then i actually saw at first
moves.73... Qa1+: he has to move to b3
moves.74... Rb1#: Well i never saw that coming when i started to play him. a very good opponent ans it was fun to play him... feel free to comment and i hope you found this fun
